name: fixts
description: CLI tool to normalize filenames and folders with timestamps to a consistent format

scripts.test:all: npm run lint && npm run test && npm run test:integration
scripts.check: npm run lint && npm run test && npm run test:integration
scripts.verify: npm run lint; LINT_CODE=$?; npm run test; TEST_CODE=$?; npm run test:integration; INT_CODE=$?; npm audit --audit-level=high; AUDIT_CODE=$?; echo ''; echo '===== VERIFICATION SUMMARY ====='; [ $LINT_CODE -eq 0 ] && echo 'âœ… Lint: PASS' || echo 'âŒ Lint: FAIL'; [ $TEST_CODE -eq 0 ] && echo 'âœ… Unit Tests: PASS' || echo 'âŒ Unit Tests: FAIL'; [ $INT_CODE -eq 0 ] && echo 'âœ… Integration Tests: PASS' || echo 'âŒ Integration Tests: FAIL'; [ $AUDIT_CODE -eq 0 ] && echo 'âœ… Security Audit: PASS' || echo 'âŒ Security Audit: FAIL'; exit $(($LINT_CODE + $TEST_CODE + $INT_CODE + $AUDIT_CODE))
scripts.verify:quick: npm run lint && npm run test
scripts.version:patch: npm run test:all && npm version patch && git push && git push --tags && npm publish
scripts.version:minor: npm run test:all && npm version minor && git push && git push --tags && npm publish
scripts.version:major: npm run test:all && npm version major && git push && git push --tags && npm publish
scripts.publish:test:
